titles.title: To provide for a study on the use of social media in security clearance investigations.
Social Media Use in Clearance Investigations Act of 2019
Social Media Use in Clearance Investigations Act of 2019
Social Media Use in Clearance Investigations Act of 2019
Social Media Use in Clearance Investigations Act of 2019
Social Media Use in Clearance Investigations Act of 2019

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Reform.
Ms. Hill (CA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1065.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 377 - 3 (Roll no. 76).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

committee.name: Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

term.name: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management

bill.summary:
Social Media Use in Clearance Investigations Act of 2019
This bill directs the Office of Management and Budget to report on the examination of social media activity during security clearance investigations.
